result.execSummary:
The defendant Muhammad A Ali was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Restitution of $377.79 to be paid to Roundy's and $612.73 to be to Target  joint and severally as a Condition of Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Muhammad A Ali in court, in custody, with attorney Robert W. Buckett.   Brian Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Buckett received a different offer and requests to review the offer with his client. Court will pass the matter. Case recalled. Counsel and defendant are filling out the paperwork. Court passes the matter. Case recalled.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1, 2 and 4.  Court finds defendant guilty. Cts. 3, 5, 6 & 7 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 3 1/2 years (Initial Confinement: 18 months - 190 days credit, Extended Supervision: 2 years)  Stayed for 3 years Probation 
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $278.00 (includes DRGOD) to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 6 days jail - consecutive
- Restitution of $377.79 to be paid to Roundy's and $612.73 to be paid to Target joint and severally as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 5 days jail - consecutive
- Conditions of  Probation: Not consume alcohol/drugs unless prescribed.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No contact with Pick n' Save or Target.  DNA Sample if not yet provided.

Ct. 2:
- 6 months jail straight time (190 days credit) concurrent to Ct. 1 and 4 Stayed for 3 years Probation - concurrent to Cts. 1 and 4
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 5 days jail - consecutive
- Conditions of  Probation: Not consume alcohol/drugs unless prescribed.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No contact with Pick n' Save or Target.  DNA surcharge waived.

Ct. 4:
- 6 months jail straight time (190 days credit) concurrent to Ct. 1 and 2 Stayed for 3 years Probation - concurrent to Cts. 1 and 2
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 5 days jail - consecutive
- Conditions of  Probation: Not consume alcohol/drugs unless prescribed.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No contact with Pick n' Save or Target.  DNA surcharge is waived.
